Initiator of the Tripartite Struggle

Dhruva was the first Rashtrakuta ruler to interfere in North Indian politics. He participated in the Tripartite Struggle for Kannauj and defeated both the Pratihara king Vatsaraja and the Pala king Dharmapala.

ЁЯСС
Symbols and Titles

Titles: 'Dharavarsha' (heavy rain), 'Kalivallabha'.
He incorporated the symbols of Ganga and Yamuna into his royal emblem, symbolizing his conquest of North India.

ЁЯЫбя╕П
Succession

Dhruva was a capable administrator. He chose his third son, Govinda III, as his successor during his lifetime, as he was the most competent.
